claim: Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated in the pivotal trial against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard-dose vaccine).

verified_evidence.quote: Study 6 (NCT02285998) enrolled subjects 50 years of age and older, randomized to receive Flublok Quadrivalent or Comparator (Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline) as an active control [see Clinical Studies (14)]. The safety analysis population included 4328 Flublok Quadrivalent recipients and 4344 Comparator vaccine recipients.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears on page 3 of the document, with only minor formatting and OCR differences. The document states: 'Study 6 (NCT02285998) enrolled subjects 50 years of age and older, randomized to receive Flublok Quadrivalent or Comparator (Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline) as an active control [see Clinical Studies (14)]. The safety analysis population included 4328 Flublok Quadrivalent recipients and 4344 Comparator vaccine recipients.' This matches the quote in all substantive details, including the study number, age group, randomization, comparator (Fluarix Quadrivalent), manufacturer, and the numbers of recipients in each group.. The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that Flublok Quadrivalent was evaluated in a trial (Study 6) where it was compared against Fluarix Quadrivalent, a standard-dose quadrivalent vaccine, in subjects 50 years and older. The details provided confirm a head-to-head evaluation, as asserted in the claim.

verified_evidence.quote: The primary efficacy endpoint of Study 6 was rtPCR-positive, protocol defined ILI due to any strain of influenza. Attack rates and relative vaccine efficacy (rVE), defined as 1 [Attack rate Flublok Quadrivalent Attack Rate Comparator], were calculated for the total efficacy population (n=8604) for the primary efficacy endpoint and for several alternative efficacy endpoints (Table 5). ... Comparator, Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline (n=4489).
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears on page 4 of the document. The text states: 'The primary efficacy endpoint of Study 6 was rtPCR-positive, protocol defined ILI due to any strain of influenza. Attack rates and relative vaccine efficacy (rVE), defined as 1 [Attack rate Flublok Quadrivalent Attack Rate Comparator], were calculated for the total efficacy population (n=8604) for the primary efficacy endpoint and for several alternative efficacy endpoints (Table 5).' Immediately after, it specifies: 'Comparator, Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline (n=4489).' verified_evidence.quote: Abbreviations: rtPCR=reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction; Comparator=U.S.-licensed quadrivalent inactivated influenza vaccine, Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline; n=number of influenza cases; N=number of subjects in treatment group; RR=relative risk (Attack Rate Flublok/Attack Rate IIV4); rVE = [(1-RR) × 100]. *Study 6 is registered as NCT02285998.

verified_evidence.quote: Study 6 (NCT02285998) enrolled subjects 50 years of age and older, randomized to receive Flublok Quadrivalent or Comparator (Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline) as an active control [see Clinical Studies (14)]. The safety analysis population included 4328 Flublok Quadrivalent recipients and 4344 Comparator vaccine recipients. The mean age of participants was 62.7 years. Overall, 58% of subjects were female, 80% white/Caucasian, 18% black/African American, 0.9% American Indian/Alaskan Native, 0.2% Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander, 0.5% Asian, 1.4% other racial groups, and 5% of Hispanic/Latino ethnicity.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote appears in the document on page 3: 'Study 6 (NCT02285998) enrolled subjects 50 years of age and older, randomized to receive Flublok Quadrivalent or Comparator (Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline) as an active control [see Clinical Studies (14)]. The safety analysis population included 4328 Flublok Quadrivalent recipients and 4344 Comparator vaccine recipients. The mean age of participants was 62.7 years. Overall, 58% of subjects were female, 80% white/Caucasian, 18% black/African American, 0.9% American Indian/Alaskan Native, 0.2% Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander, 0.5% Asian, 1.4% other racial groups, and 5% of Hispanic/Latino ethnicity.' The factual content, numbers, and technical details match the quote to verify.. The quote directly supports the claim. No inference is required; the information is explicit and complete.

verified_evidence.quote: The primary efficacy endpoint of Study 6 was rtPCR-positive, protocol defined ILI due to any strain of influenza. Attack rates and relative vaccine efficacy (rVE), defined as 1 [Attack rate Flublok Quadrivalent Attack Rate Comparator], were calculated for the total efficacy population (n=8604) for the primary efficacy endpoint and for several alternative efficacy endpoints (Table 5). Comparator, Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline (n=4489).

image_evidence.claim: Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated in the pivotal trial against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard-dose vaccine).
image_evidence.explanation: A table showing attack rates and relative risks (RR) for PCR-confirmed influenza cases, comparing an IIV4 vaccine group (n/N, % attack rate) against a comparator group. Footnotes define RR, rVE, and identify the comparator as U.S.-licensed standard-dose influenza vaccine, Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GSK. Evidence: Footnote stating Comparator = U.S.-licensed standard-dose influenza vaccine, Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GSK, alongside data for IIV4 (quadrivalent) vaccine group. The image shows that in the pivotal trial the IIV4 (quadrivalent) vaccine was evaluated against Fluarix Quadrivalent, which supports the claim. Note: The table header is partially cut off and the brand name ‘Flublok’ is not explicitly visible, but IIV4 in context refers to the quadrivalent Flublok vaccine.

detailed_analysis.image_description: A table showing attack rates and relative risks (RR) for PCR-confirmed influenza cases, comparing an IIV4 vaccine group (n/N, % attack rate) against a comparator group. Footnotes define RR, rVE, and identify the comparator as U.S.-licensed standard-dose influenza vaccine, Fluarix Quadrivalent, manufactured by GSK.
